intro: Nassauvia sprengelioides, commonly known as the desert honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow to orange tubular flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to harsh desert environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid ecosystems.
